title: 5 Liverpool legends who simply loved scoring against Everton ahead of this weekend's Merseyside derby
text:
Sport 5 Liverpool legends who simply loved scoring against Everton ahead of this weekend's Merseyside derby From Ian Rush to Luis Suarez, these Reds stars scored some goals to remember against city rivals Everton Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Five Liverpool stars who loved playing against Everton Share this video     
The Merseyside derby has seen some great games of football over the years. 
In 227 matches Liverpool have clinched victory in 90 of them while Everton have earned bragging rights 66 times. 
Of course with great wins come great goals, and quite frankly we've been spoiled. 
Liverpool heroes like Harry Chambers and Jack Parkinson bagged many a goal in the fixture as did Jack Balmer and Gordon Hodgson. Jurgen Klopp's Liverpool side will host Everton on the weekend (Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images) 
Below we look at some of the more recent stars who have made the difference in the derby as well as two of the club's biggest legends. 
Together this lot bagged 49 goals against the Toffees, enjoy: Ian Rush 
Goals: 25 
A Liverpool legend in every sense of the word. 
Ian Rush, who is the club's all-time record goal scorer with 346, also holds the record for finding the back of the net against the Toffees. Ian Rush found the back of the net 25 times against Everton (Photo: Getty Images) 
He notched a staggering 25 in his time and Everton fans were no doubt delighted when he left the club for Leeds United in 1996. 
Rush's most memorable Merseyside derby came in 1982, when he smashed four goals past the Toffees in a 5-0 win at Goodison Park. Steven Gerrard 
Games: 27 
Goals: 8 
Like Rush, Steven Gerrard is someone who needs no introduction in Liverpool, and another star who loved a goal against the Toffees. 
Born in Whiston, the now 36-year-old always had a fans' understanding about how much the game meant to everyone in the city. Steven Gerrard scored a goal to remember against the Toffees in 2001 (Photo: LFC) 
And of course made sure that knowledge transferred onto the pitch in the form of eight goals in 27 games against the Toffees. 
Perhaps his most memorable was his first derby goal - a thunderbolt of a shot that stunned everyone at Goodison Park in 2001. Robbie Fowler 
Games: 17 
Goals: 6 
One of the game's great finishers, Robbie Fowler was always going to get goals against Everton, and that he did. 
In 17 games for the Reds he found the back of the net six times. Robbie Fowler bagged two in a 3-2 victory back in 1999 (Photo: Allsport) 
His most memorable Merseyside derby came in 1999 when he bagged two great goals in a 3-2 win - securing Liverpool's first victory over Everton in five years. 
His infamous 'eating the grass' celebration also made an appearance in this game. Kenny Dalglish 
Games: 23 
Goals: 5 
King Kenny is a fan's favourite having represented the club as a player and later going on to manage them. 
He found the back of the net five times against Everton and in total for Liverpool scored on a staggering 172 occasions. King Kenny scored just 20 seconds from kick-off back in 1985 (Photo: Getty Images) 
In 1985 the Reds recorded a 3-2 win over their rivals at Goodison park, with Dalglish getting himself on the score sheet. 
The game was particularly memorable for the Scottish striker as he put his side ahead just 20 seconds after kick-off. Luis Suarez 
Games: 6 
Goals: 5 
Despite not playing in half as many Merseyside derbies as the above legends, Luis Suarez made his mark in them. 
In just six appearances he found the back of the net five times. Luis Suarez dived in front of David Moyes after putting Liverpool ahead in 2012 (Photo: Getty) 
A controversial character but also a genius with a football at his feet, his most memorable goal against the Toffees came in a 2-2 draw in 2012. 
The Reds threw away a two-goal lead on the day, but it was Suarez's celebration to breaking the deadlock - a dive at the feet of David Moyes, after he claimed the Uruguayan went down too easily - that will always be remembered. poll loading What's your Mersey derby prediction? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
